page.title: 05CHURCH BUILDING-ST NINIANS
page.content: {Ninian}who came from the Borders,heard of the Christian Religion from France.He preached all over Scotland and founded a mud and wood{Church}at St.Ninians around 400 A.D.The first stone building was dedicated 1241 and in 1734 a{bell tower}was added.The third reconstruction was used by the Jacobites to store gunpowder and it was blown up in 1746. The present stone building was built by 1751 and was to be temporary. It is still in regular use.The bell rings in the original tower and the church hall is used by many clubs. The Church is roughly rectangular with a pulpit,communion table,choir stall and pews.There are pictorial stained glass windows and a pipe organ taken from a cinema.The church plate is of historic value.Members support a {missionary}in Malawi.(D.RAE)
